reviewText: This gives you every Twilight Zone episode made (I am not sure if the hour-long ones are on here or not).  The only thing I don't like about them is that there is no option on each disc's menu screen to be able to have all of the shows on a disc play.  You have to click on each one before it will play.  However it gives you the chance to skip any episodes you don't want to play by having it that way.

reviewText: I got this on an Amazon sale and it's a good value.As noted, there are no extras but that's not a problem for me.The picture and sound quality are good.There's something for just about everyone in this set, if you don't like some episodes there's a good chance you'll find ones that you do like.Many of these are twist ending classics.Lots of big name stars show up in these episodes.In total, it's a refreshing trip back in time.

reviewText: Rod Serling was a genious hosting this show beginning with the first episode Where is Everyone all the way to the last one The Bewitching Pool. Other good ones are his Christmas one Night of the Meek and among others Time Enough at Last Ring-a-Ding Girl Static Shadow Play The Monsters are Due on Maple StreetThe Hitchhiker Nothing in the Dark The Afer Hours and thats just the beginning. He did several episodes and all of them are worth repeated watching. Trust me. You should get this.

reviewText: The show deserves five-stars. My one-star rating rating is for RLJ Entertainment for shamefully placing The Twilight Zone Definitive Edition on moratorium (i.e., it will no longer be available for wholesale purchase) beginning December 1st. Why not let buyers have a high-end option? Perhaps because if they did, no one would buy this cheap, bare-bones set (especially since if you look around, you can, at least for now, get The Definitive Edition for less). Send a message to the short-sighted decision-makers who claim they released this new set so you would have a choice but who in reality are trying to make sure you don't have a choice by discarding the superior set. Please consider not buying this set. Normally I appreciate having a bare bones set as a cheaper option, but after December 1st, RLJ Entertainment doesn't want you to have any options.To everyone who worked on the original Twilight Zone Definitive Edition release, what you achieved can never be erased by shortsighted business decisions. To those who went the extra mile to add commentaries for the majority of episodes (and multiple commentaries for several episodes), to those who thought to use Rod Serling's college lectures for commentaries, to those who worked above and beyond to include interviews with cast and crew members, to those who worked tirelessly to include isolated music scores--and add intros and outros. And network promo spots. And the TWILIGHT ZONE radio dramas and comic books...to all those who showed it was possible to create the kind of DVD set that loyal fans deserve, your work is an inspiration to everyone trying to release quality DVD sets with terrific special features but who are blocked by the lawyers who run the studios now, by irrational decisions that change with the wind. What you guys did with The Twilight Zone Definitive Edition restores confidence. Thank you for that.
summary: RLJ Entertainment is not giving you an option, they're taking it away...

reviewText: CBS DVD and RLJ Entertainment release the perfect present for any classic sci-fi enthusiast in the form of "The Twilight Zone: The Complete Series" collection. All 156 episodes of creator Rod Serling's epic anthology show are found in this special box set. They're conveniently housed on 25 discs for easy access to any of its five seasons.From 1959 to 1964, the mastermind used his half hour and hour-long platforms to delve into the frightening and exciting worlds of the unknown. Serling used these tales to teach lessons and unleash subtle and not so subtle social commentaries on a captive audience.At the time of its five year run, "The Twilight Zone" was a launching ground for many incredible actors who would go on to do great things. What other show could boast having guest stars like Art Carney, Burgess Meredith, Cliff Robertson, Dennis Hopper, Bill Bixby, Leonard Nimoy, Burt Reynolds, Don Rickles, Jack Klugman, Robert Redford, Lee Marvin, Martin Landau, Telly Savalas, and William Shatner? Each episode would take these iconic actors and place them in a mysterious and unsettling situation that would unravel a moral tale in the end.The audio and video quality is much better than many would expect from a show that's over 50 years old. After seeing some of these episodes on syndicated TV, I was quite surprised at the way they looked and sounded. A complete series box set was released several years ago, so I don't know if they went back in again for this specific collection and restored them even more."The Twilight Zone: The Complete Series" will please viewers and consumers who never picked it up until now. It's the perfect way to collect this monumental and groundbreaking show which influenced hundreds of filmmakers and kick started the anthology medium for TV and movies. This is an essential piece of any sci-fi or horror fan's home entertainment library.
summary: “The Twilight Zone: The Complete Series” the Perfect Way to Collect Monumental Show

reviewText: This collection is for The twilight Zone purist who just wants to watch the shows. It is for the binge watcher who just wishes to watch the classic television show episodes and not pay for the opinions of others. The overall video quality is good with the exception being the live broadcast episodes.So, if you love good quality classic television and cannot wait for MeTV, TVLand, et al to broadcast all the TZ episodes, this collection is for you. "You are about to enter the twilight zone.

reviewText: First off, they are discontinuing the definitive edition sets, which are far superior than this bare bone set.  Why would they do such a silly thing is beyond me.  But upon second  thought, I can see why they did it, the Definitive Edition sets have been out for many  years now, and they now have the Blu- ray sets out, which are superior to the definitive sets in every way.So, I can see them making a bare bones release for those who could care les about all the extra features and just want to watch the twilight zone episodes, so this is a great set for those people.Hopefully, they do a similar,  bare bones release with the Blu-ray box set.
summary: It's no "Definitive"  Edition, but ok for casual fans.

reviewText: Based on commentary about loss of the "DEFINITIVE" collection I checked reviews for that to see why it was so great.  The main theme there was that it is plagued by cheap knockoffs.  The majority of posters had the same basic comment.  Maybe that is why that item is going to be put on hold.  If the stories are true then it seems like the right thing to do to me.Additionally this set is half the price of the DEFINITIVE collection so maybe a lot of people are willing to give up the "EXTRAS" to save the money.  That sounds like more choice to me not less.

reviewText: I have the Season One "Definitive" edition also. I can't speak for the later seasons, but on Season One the commentaries are few and uninformative, and I was disappointed. The tape recording audio from some of Serling's Masters' classes was low,  low fi. (Which is really a shame, because Rod Serling was an enchanting speaker, both in lecture and one-on-one, looking over your sci-fi story, and finding it, ah, without merit.)Image Entertainment's website says that this new "Episodes Only Collection" release has "ALL 156 EPISODES IN PRISTINE HIGH-DEFINITION OF ROD SERLING'S CLASSIC, GROUNDBREAKING SERIES IN ONE BOX SET! Travel to another dimension of sight and sound again and again through these stellar remastered high-definition film transfers."That's really all you need, although I've found Marc Scott Zicree's "The Twilight Zone Companion" to be a nice adjunct to the series. It's now in a second edition and available here.

reviewText: No extras, just the episodes but that is all I really wanted.  I could not afford something with commentary etc.. but still missed the old series.  I am very thankful it came at the price it did and I can watch the old episodes when I want.  Thank you... If you are looking for something modern or smooth transition this is not it.  You can definitely tell when they break for a commercial (even though you do not see it) and so it is what it is.  All said, if you want the old black and white original series ( moral with every story by brilliant Rod, then it does what you want.  I am happy with it since It is more affordable than the fancier sets. I am grateful to be able to get it without breaking the bank to do so.  Thank you again Amazon.  SaraBeth Williams

reviewText: It was marvelous to see all the episodes again.  The quality of these discs is excellent, with greater clarity than I have ever seen.  There was one episode that wasn't included.  It was concerned with a person being transported to Pearl Harbor just before the attack.  This one was done before the series was considered for a season, so I suppose it isn't considered part of the series.  Possibly, this pilot is available elsewhere.
